meanings.definition: A feeling of disgust or revulsion.
meanings.sent1: The sight of spoiled milk made me feel ewk.
meanings.sent2: The ewk on his face was evident when he saw the cockroach.
meanings.sent3: She made an ewk face when she accidentally stepped on the slug.
meanings.sent4: The ewk in the room was palpable as the garbage piled up.
meanings.sent5: The ewk in the air was so strong, I had to leave the room.

meanings.sent1: I ewk at the thought of eating snails.
meanings.sent2: She ewks loudly whenever she sees spiders.
meanings.sent3: He likes to ewk loudly to show his dislike for broccoli.
meanings.sent4: The movie was so bad, it made everyone in the theater ewk.
meanings.sent5: The smell from the dumpster made me ewk uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: An interjection used to express disgust or distaste.
meanings.sent1: Ewk! What is that awful smell?
meanings.sent2: Ewk, I can't believe you ate that!
meanings.sent4: Ewk! That's the grossest thing I've ever seen!
meanings.sent5: Ewk, the texture of this pudding is so slimy!
